reviewText: Great family movie!!! We loved Elf-Man!!! He inspired all of us... The movie was refreshing, hopeful and filled with integrity and love.. The perfect Christmas movie to watch year after year. I highly recommend everyone buying it for there home collection.

The 5 star reviews have been written by people who have a link to the production of this movie, trust me. Read them, they are not the average movie goers comments, they are clichd rubbish, just like the movie is. Don't waste your time like we did.

The little person from Jackass is actually really good in Elf-Man--funny and smart-assed without being annoying. The movie is really funny and with some genuinely sweet moments, along with some good ol-fashioned bumbly Home Alone-esque schtick. The kids are really appealing as well (I say this because in some Christmas movies, the children annoy me). Definitely worth checking out!

The first couple reviews must have been written by the same person because the movie is HORRIBLE!!! The acting sucks and its just an overall b-rated movie. Don't let the "star" of the movie fool you......Save your money and rent it if you really wish so see it. There's a reason why it didn't make it to theaters!!!!

Just got through watching Elf-man and was very disappointed! After reading the reviews (all 4 stars), I was anticipating a really good Christmas movie to watch with my son. Unfortunately, the movie started off slow and never really got any better! Mediocre at best! Save your money!
A heartwarming and funny Christmas movie for everyone.  Two new, up and coming child actors who are sure to make you smile.  A great holiday movie for all.
A Christmas treasure filled with  plenty of laughter and heartwarming moments.  A fun movie for ALL ages, something to add to the Christmas wish list!

I got a chance to watch Elf-Man and have to tell you how wonderful this movie is!!! Its visually amazing and the Acting was so enjoyable with a cast of characters that light up the screen! You will laugh out loud with the incredible story and hilarious hijinks that ensue. And within all the mayhem, I especially enjoyed Mirelly Taylor's roll as Amy. She brings such a charmingly-funny and romantic-beauty to the role, that sucks you in and grounds the movie to pull everything together.

It is everything you'd want in a Christmas movie, with all the bells and whistles, laughs and jingles, that only the holiday season can bring. I recommend this movie to everyone for any occasion. Its a movie that just, down right makes you want to smile!!!

This was really an all-around pleasant surprise.  The Elf-Man himself is of course the eye candy we came to see and deserves every accolade we can offer him -- he's wry, spry, and wise.  The rest of the cast is also terrific, the kids are particular stand-outs, but everyone is solid.  And so is the overall production itself right down to the clever special effects.  This really is the perfect Christmas sock stuffer.  A real treat:)

Bursting at the seams with every imaginable trope and cliche, this film will entertain parts of you that you didn't know existed. With a weak plot and worse acting, this movie proves to be so terrible that it's hilarious. It brings countless new treasures to the Christmas movie genre, from the magically alive fruitcake to the power of mistletoe (hint: it's not what you expect). In an unprecedented mashup of Christmas magic and superhero action, Elf-Man provides an cinematic experience like no other. This film is sure to join our family's list of traditional Christmas films, and to be enjoyed every year with a stiff glass of eggnog and countless bouts of laughter.

A word of warning: at a few unfortunate points, the movie does have some intentional comedic moments. Simply grimace at these and move on to laugh at the rest of the film.

Terrible movie, terrible acting, terrible story and has nothing to do with Christmas. Jeffrey Combs (the main bad guy) is a good actor in other shows, but his role in this movie is still terrible and it's sad that he would have taken such a ridiculous role. If you want to watch a Christmas movie, don't bother. This is not a Christmas movie.
There are so few edifying Christmas movies you can watch with your young kids, so this was a very pleasant surprise.  Not going to win an Oscar, but great family entertainment.

this is a awesome movie.  you know some of these low budget straight to dvd-blu-ray movies are better than the ones that come to theatres and this is one of those movies. i'm really big into superheroes. so when I saw this at the video store I said what the heck and rented it. and I was not disappointed. this is a good clean Christmas family movie that the whole family can enjoy. the story is good, the acting is good and the special effects are good. great movie. if you have not seen this movie then I recommend you do

I thought this was a cute movie! Don't expect it to be anything like your Hollywood A-movies like Home Alone,Santa Claus or even Elf. Sure,the script isn't all that but it still is enjoyable to watch. If they ever make an Elf on the Shelf movie they should get the idea from this movie. A little girl made a wish and the elf came to life to make that wish come true. If you like made for tv movies. If you like Hallmark or Lifetime movies,this is for you. Both my 11 y/o and 9y/o kids liked it. I was looking for more Christmas movies to watch and glad I saw this. Will definitely be added to my collection to be enjoyed for many Christmases to come.
Way better than expected! Enjoy!

This will appeal to the younger kids.  Give them silly fun and a elf super hero and it will make their day.  It's just a entertaining little B flick for the wee ones so don't go expecting too much out of it and the kids will love it.  Not having seen Wee Man before I thought he did a good job as Elf Man and you have to chuckle at Jeffrey Combs as the leader of the villains especially when he sends his henchman out for a can of Troll Off.  Combs loves to play offbeat roles whether its the hero or a villain and gives a fun performance.  Incidentally I loved the scene of Elf Man and Combs facing down each other like a scene from a Eastwood spaghetti western and instead of a tumble weed blowing across between them a Christmas wreath comes rolling by in the wind.  They tossed in a few subtle tongue in cheek jokes that adults might pick up on.
One of my son's favorite Christmas movies!
I think my expectations were too high. Both my granddaughter and myself were disappointed with this film. So this assessment was true for two generations.
My kid adores this movie,  so so funny,  wee Man Rocks!!!!!!!  Me and my kid laughed so hard at his silly self

I am shocked to see that there are so many reviews of over four-stars, but that just goes to show "Vive La Différence!" and that there is definitely something for everyone.  I really, truly like Wee Man and it was due to this that I got this movie.  Mistake!  He really was pretty horrible.  It is obvious that stunts are his forte and acting falls way down the line.  Combine his acting with a poorly written script and you get something that isn't even worthy of a "what-shall-we-watch-now-that-Rudolf-The-Rednose-Reindeer-is-over?" category.  Although the kids in the movie were cute as was Mackenzie Astin, their acting also could have shown a lot of improvement.  They always say that directing is 95% casting...maybe it's purely the casting director's fault that this isn't even worth a late-late-late-late-late-night-nothing-else-is-on-TV movie.  I give this, at the most, one-star and strongly recommend you skip it altogether.

You know it's bad when an 11 year old says, "This movie is horrible. The acting stinks." He was absolutely right. Wee Man simply cannot act. The others maybe are ok, but the script is so poor that they don't have a chance. If it helps to put this in perspective, my son loved "The Three Stooges" and "Mr. Bean". 'Nough said.
I would have laughed alot more if this movie was even more low budget, with worse acting and worse special effects, but my young kids liked it.
Good wholesome entertainment with fun , laughter , surprizes. I laughed , cried , and cheered! Just waiting for a sequel!

I brought this movie with me to give to my five year old nephew at Christmas. Let's just say, we had to watch it three times that evening! It was adorable, slap-stick, awesome cast, with a good message. And, for a five year old boy, you can't go wrong with a superhero elf...he flew around "avoiding mistletoe" for an hour afterwards.  It was definitely a hit, and even the adults were laughing. Love it!
It turned out a bit better than I expected. There were a few decent moments. Too bad the Elf Man himself was so poor at acting, with a better actor in that role, could have been much better.
This was a great way to spend an evening during the holidays! It was entertaining for all ages!  We laughed and laughed!

I was looking for a new Christmas film to watch with my kids during our Christmas break and I ran across this tittle on Amazon and decided to buy it. When I relized that Jason Acuna (Wee man from the "Jack Ass" movies)was the lead actor I thought that maybe this wasn't a kids movie. Boy was I wrong. Ok maybe not totally wrong. The truth is, it is a family movie. There is something for everybody in this film. Its action,romance,and comedy all rolled into one. Jason, who plays the elfman, is so warm and genuine in this role. He is very Good. The cast is very talented and I enjoyed watching this film with my family. This DVD is the new "Watch it over and over again" film for my kids.

The reviews saying this pile of crap is great must be related to the actors or production because this is the most disjointed collection of plots from bad Christmas movies past I have ever seen.
The acting is beyond bad and the storyline is pathetic.
This is a "Home alone" wannabe without the cute or the funny.
Save your money and your time
If you're looking for a sweet Christmas movie to share with the family, then check this out! I like the warm settings and the bad guys crack me up! Will watch this one again, and again.

As a native of Frederick, Maryland, where this movie was filmed, I'm pretty much doomed to be biased in its favor. That being said, I tried my best to be objective when I first saw it, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Make no mistake, it's definitely a direct-to-video Christmas movie, so you won't find word-class production values here; the CGI is fairly dodgy, and Elf-Man's costume (the one he wears on the front cover of the DVD) doesn't look "heroic" so much as "assembled on someone's dining room table."

But that's all beside the point, really. You'd be hard-pressed to find a Christmas movie with more genuine heart; the story is delightful without ever taking itself too seriously, and the cast and crew's enthusiasm for the project really comes through. Although it gets a bit sappy near the end, overall the story is satisfyingly tight and well thought out, and funny to boot. If you're looking for a light family movie for Christmas, this is a great choice!
This is a great family movie.  It has everything - heart, action and fun.  I've seen it twice already!  This is the kind of film they used to make, and I'm hoping they make more of.  I loved it.
This is a wonderful movie for the family to watch at Christmas time. It was funny with the good guys vs the bad guys. A real feel good movie.

If you have children 12 and under you can put this DVD on with every assurance that it's a sweet and funny Christmas movie they can enjoy with or without you. If you want to join your kids watching it you too will have a lovely time in the charming world of Elf-Man. There's humor, there's heart, there's action and on top of it all  Santa and his reindeer make an appearance as well. This is a movie you can show and enjoy every Christmas for years to come. Long Live Elf-Man!
Have two kids both under 9.  They loved it! Must see Christmas movie! Would definately watch again and possibly buy.

i watched this film on my  computer but it wouldn't play through.  it kept  pausing to load.  really irritating.  i kept saying to myself, "i can't do this" but i couldn't stop watching as i had to see what came next.  it has the feel of Home Alone but is much more daring and creative.  for one thing it has a dwarf in the lead role. in an industry that demands bankable stars for a film to get made this one is a maverick from the start. for snother thing it is just very entertaining.  as a family film with a dwarf star  . . . it is giant fun.
This is a thoroughly well-crafted holiday movie, perfect for young kids -- but adults will have plenty of laughs. Wonderful cast and great music score. The child actors are especially good.
Good family movie to watch for the entire family.  All 4 of my kids enjoyed it.  Love Christmas movies to get us into the spirit of Christmas.

My family received this movie as a gift. At first I thought this was only for the kids, but I gave it a try as well and thought it was actually kind of brilliant. Yes, some aspects are a little cheesy but if you pay close attention there are subtle nuances that are totally great. I recommend this for kids especially, but I think parents can get a good laugh, too. Just wait for the opening scene with Grandma in the car... Hilarious!!

Elf-Man is a very cute Christmas comedy that is, I assume, directed at kids and families, but is something that I enjoyed, as well.  Full of lighthearted comedy, slapstick antics, and heart tugging moments, it is sure to be a Christmas staple for years to come.  A heartwarming Christmas comedy with a superhero...sign me up.

Finally, a family movie that is actually safe to watch without worrying about bad language or too much skin.  My kids, 5 and 9 love this movie so much we have watched it 5 times. It's got enough physical comedy to keep everyone laughing and a nice message about doing something good for others. It's a great stocking stuffer and I have purchased a few as back up gifts just in case I need something at the last minute.
Terrible

This would only work if you threw YouTube stars into it and was more aware of how bad it was. Then it would at least be fun. We enjoyed laughing at the cringyness of it though, that's what we were wanting going in so.
Goofy, but funny!!
